attributes.action: overhaul train ticket pricing so that a single ticket is pretty much half a return ticket
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If I'm taking a triangular journey, the current pricing strategy is clearly totally unfair. In Germany (and I believe, many other mainland europe countries), there is very little use of the "return ticket". Attempting to purchase one usually gives you two singles on the one slip. In other words, you pay for what you use. Why should the UK not be the same?
